gurmukhi: hsy isMD is`DM ] mcy bIr kRu`DM ]29]106]
transliteration: Hase Sindh Siddhan|| Mache Boor Kruddhan||29||106||
translation: All of them laugh and the warriors are inebriatedwith rage.29.106.

gurmukhi: fkw f`k fwkYN ] hkw h`k hwkYN ]
translation: The vampires are belching and the egoist warriors are shouting.

gurmukhi: Bkw BuMk ByrI ] fmk fwm fyrI ]30]107]
transliteration: Bhakaa Bhounk Bheroo|| Damak Daam Deoo||30||107||
translation: The drums are creating loud sound and there are clanging noises.30.107.

gurmukhi: mhwN bIr gwjy ] nvM nwd bwjy ]
transliteration: Mahaan Boor Gadje|| Navan Naad Baaje||
translation: The mighty warriors are roaring and the new instruments are being sounded.

gurmukhi: Drw gom g`jy ] dRugw dYq B`jy ]31]108]
transliteration: Dharaa Gom Gadje|| Drougad Dait Bhajje||31||108||
translation: The trumpets are resounding and the forces of Durga and the demons are fighting.31.108.

gurmukhi: jyqk bwx cly Air Er qy PUl kI mwl huAY kMT ibrwjy ]
transliteration: Jetak Baan Chale Ar(i) Or Te Phool Koo Maal Huai Kanth Biraaje||
translation: All the arrows shot by the enemy bedeck as garlands of flowers around the neck of the goddess.

gurmukhi: dwnv puMgv pyK AcMBv Cof Bjy rn eyk n gwjy ]
transliteration: Daanav Poungad Pekh Achanndhav Chhodh Bhaje Ran Ek Na Gadje||
translation: Seeing this wonder the forces of the enemy have run away from the battlefield and none could stay there.

gurmukhi: kuMjr puMj igry iqh Taur Bry sB sRoxq pY gn qwjy ]
transliteration: Kounjar Pounj Gire Tih Thaur Bhare Sabh Sronat Pai Gad Taaje||
translation: Many elephants have fallen at that place alongwith many healthy steeds, all are smeared with blood.

gurmukhi: jwnuk nIrD m`iD Cpy BRim BUDr ky BX qy ng Bwjy ]32]109]
transliteration: Jaanouk Nooradh Maddh(i0 Chhape Bhram(i) Bhoodhar Ke Bhay Te Nag Bhaaje||32||109||
translation: It appears that running away out of the fear of Indra, the mountains have hidden themselves in the sea.32.109.

gurmukhi: sRI jgnnwQ kmwn lY hwQ pRmwiQn sMK sRjXo jb ju`DM ]
transliteration: Sroo Jagadnnth Kamaan Lai Haath Pramaathin Sankh Srajyo Jab Juddhan||
translation: When the Mother of Universe waged the war, holding her bow in her hand and blowing her conch;

gurmukhi: gwhq sYx sMGwrq sUr b`bkiq isMG BRmXo rx kRu`DM ]
transliteration: Gadhat Sain Sanhaarat Soor Babbkat(i) Singh Bhramyo Ran Kruddhan||
translation: Her lion walked roaring in the field in great ire, crushing and destroying the forces of the enemy.

gurmukhi: kauch Byd ABydiq AMg su rMg auqMg so soiBq su`DM ]
transliteration: Kaouchah Bhed Abhedat(i) An Su Ran Outan So Sobhit Suddhan||
translation: He goes on tearing with his nails the armours on the bodies of the warriors and the torn limbs appear like;
